clusters.title: Teen dies in crash involving tractor, semitrailer and horse truck
clusters.neutral_headline: Teenager Dies in Three-Vehicle Crash on Highway

items.title: Teen dies in crash involving tractor, semitrailer and horse truck
items.standfirst: Police hope to speak with a man who stopped to help at the scene of a fatal three-vehicle crash on the Kamilaroi Highway near Wee Waa.
items.content: Police hope to speak with a man who stopped to help at the scene of a fatal three-vehicle crash on the Kamilaroi Highway near Wee Waa.

items.title: Boy, 14, killed in horror three-vehicle crash
items.standfirst: P olice wish to speak with a man who gave assistance to the fatally injured teenager at the scene.
items.content: A teenage boy has died following a horrific three-vehicle crash in northern NSW.The 14-year-old was travelling in a light rigid horse truck towing a caravan about 3pm yesterday on the Kamilaroi Highway, about 10km east of the town Wee Waa in New England, when it was involved in a crash.An unidentified man - who was not involved in the crash ­- provided first aid to the boy.READ MORE: Priscilla, Superman actor Terence Stamp dead at 87 Paramedics also treated the boy, but he died at the scene.The driver of the horse truck – a 38-year-old man – has been taken to hospital in a stable condition for treatment and mandatory testing. One horse in the horse truck was euthanised due to injuries, while three other horses received treatment.The male drivers of the other vehicles involved in the crash - a tractor and semi-trailer - were not injured and underwent mandatory testing.Police set up a crime scene and crash investigators launched inquiries.Officers believe the man who first provided assistance at the scene may be able to help their investigation and wish to speak with him.Sign up here to receive our daily newsletters and breaking news alerts, sent straight to your inbox.

clusters.ai_summary:
• A fatal three-vehicle crash occurred on the Kamilaroi Highway.
• A fourteen-year-old boy died in the crash.
• Police seek to speak with a man who helped at the scene.
• The crash involved a tractor, semitrailer, and horse truck.
• Police are investigating the circumstances of the crash.

clusters.title: Father stabbed 11 times in Kew East home invasion while defending wife and toddlers
clusters.neutral_headline: Father Stabbed During Home Invasion in Melbourne

items.title: Father stabbed 11 times in Kew East home invasion while defending wife and toddlers
items.standfirst: A Kew East father suffered a broken arm and will require eye surgery after he fought five home invaders who threatened his wife, two toddlers and elderly parents during an alleged violent home invasion.
items.content: A Kew East father suffered a broken arm and will require eye surgery after he fought five home invaders who threatened his wife, two toddlers and elderly parents during an alleged violent home invasion.

items.title: Three charged after Melbourne dad allegedly stabbed 11 times
items.standfirst: A man and two teens have been charged after a Melbourne father was allegedly stabbed multiple times while trying to fight against a gang who allegedly broke into his Kew East home.
items.content: Three people have been charged after a Melbourne father was allegedly stabbed with a machete while trying to fight against a gang who broke into his home in Kew East.Police claim the 39-year-old man's wife was forced into a separate room with their two sleeping toddlers as the group sped off in the couple's car.Two teenage boys, aged 16 and 17, along with a 24-year-old man have all been charged with multiple offences in relation to the incident, including false imprisonment, aggravated home invasion and intentionally cause serious injury.READ MORE: Light plane crash lands on Sydney golf course The "awful" incident even left senior detectives shaken."I've never seen anything like this, this is awful," Victoria Police's Leeanne Trusler said."There's nothing to indicate it being premeditated, they've just chosen this house and destroyed a family."The gang of five arrived on Oxford Street just before 4am today.Allegedly armed with a knife and machete, they used garden shears from the shed to smash a window.Once inside, they forced the husband and wife into separate rooms and allegedly stabbed the 39-year-old man 11 times. He was taken to hospital with a fractured arm, cuts to his face and will need to undergo eye surgery.READ MORE: Ratepayers have named the best local councils in Australia His parents, aged 69 and 70, were allegedly also cut and bruised as they tried to help."They're not used to people fighting back, and this home owner fought back," Trusler said."It's gotta stop. This has got to stop. Someone is going to be seriously hurt. Well, someone has now been seriously hurt. It's beyond a joke."His two kids, just two and three years old, thankfully slept through the attack.Their 34-year-old mother was treated for minor injuries while their nanny was uninjured.Police say four of the offenders got into the victim's BMW, while the fifth offender allegedly left in the vehicle they arrived in. Two males who are believed to have been involved in the incident remain on the run."Aggravated burglaries, that have got to one every hour across the state are now getting to the stage they are so violent that we've now seen a father stabbed with his children at home and each and every Victorian will feel that today," Victoria's Opposition Leader Brad Battin said.The 24-year-old Caroline Springs man was remanded to appear at Melbourne Magistrates' Court in November.The 17-year-old from the Frankston area and the 16-year-old also from the Caroline Springs area were both remanded to appear at a children's court at a later date.Anyone who witnessed the incident, has CCTV/dashcam footage or any information that could assist police is urged to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or submit a confidential report online.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

clusters.ai_summary:
• A father was stabbed eleven times during a home invasion.
• The father was defending his wife, toddlers, and parents.
• Five home invaders were involved in the incident.
• A man and two teens have been charged in connection.
• The incident occurred in Kew East, Melbourne.

clusters.title: Thief steals million-dollar Ferrari as family sleeps
clusters.neutral_headline: Million-Dollar Ferrari Stolen from Melbourne Home

items.title: Thief steals million-dollar Ferrari as family sleeps
items.standfirst: Over three hours the burglar stole the Ferrari and three other luxury vehicles from a home in Melbourne's inner east.
items.content: Over three hours the burglar stole the Ferrari and three other luxury vehicles from a home in Melbourne's inner east.

items.title: Four cars including $1 million Ferrari stolen from Melbourne home
items.standfirst: T he family was asleep as the thief removed the cars one by one in Balwyn North last week.
items.content: A man is sought after four luxury cars, including a million-dollar Ferrari, were stolen from a Melbourne home last week.Police said a man gained entrance to a property on Greythorn Road in Balwyn North at about 1.30am on August 15.Inside the home, the man stole four sets of car keys, a wallet, and some wireless headphones.READ MORE: Three charged after Melbourne dad allegedly stabbed 11 times During the next three hours, while a family slept inside the home, the man stole four cars from its garage and carport.The cars include a red 2019 Ferrari 488 Pista Couple with a black and white stripe and the registration plate AYV 298.It is worth about $1 million.READ MORE: One man dead after double shooting outside Sydney pub The man also stole a green or teal 2024 BMW M3 Wagon with the licence plate DFR 369, a black 2009 Mercedes CLS63 with plates reading XLE 930, and a black 2011 BMW 135I with the registration XTB 851. None of the cars have been recovered.Police have released an image of a man they believe may be able to help the investigation.Anybody with information is urged to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or online.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

clusters.ai_summary:
• A thief stole a million-dollar Ferrari from a Melbourne home.
• Three other luxury vehicles were also stolen.
• The family was asleep during the burglary.
• The theft occurred in Balwyn North.
• The cars were removed one by one.

clusters.title: Priscilla, Superman actor Terence Stamp dead at 87
clusters.neutral_headline: Actor Terence Stamp Dies at Age Eighty-Seven

items.title: Priscilla, Superman actor Terence Stamp dead at 87
items.standfirst: T he British actor who lit up the silver screen was an icon of 1960s Swinging London.
items.content: Terence Stamp, the British actor who became synonymous with Swinging London in the 1960s, has died, his family said Sunday, according to Reuters. He was 87 years old.Stamp first came to prominence when he took on the titular role in the 1962 film Billy Budd. The black and white drama, directed by Peter Ustinov, who also starred, saw Stamp nominated for an Academy Award for best supporting actor - the only Oscar nomination of his lengthy career.He went on to star in a host of films in the 1960s, among them John Schlesinger's Thomas Hardy adaptation Far From the Madding Crowd and Ken Loach's first feature film, Poor Cow.READ MORE: European leaders to join Zelenskyy for meeting with Trump Stamp was a star who rose from humble beginnings in London's East End, about as far from Hollywood as you can get. He was born on July 22, 1938, to parents Ethel and Thomas, a merchant seaman.In a 2013 interview with the British Film Institute (BFI), Stamp revealed that his father tried to deter him from a career in showbiz."He genuinely believed that people like us didn't do things like that," he said. But his mother, he said, "loved every second of it."READ MORE: How the Epstein files have turned Donald Trump's base against him "In retrospect, my mother must have always wanted me to do it and must have wished that she could have been more supportive. But my dad was the head of the family and I never really knew what he thought of it because he was of that generation," he said."He was a merchant seaman, he shovelled coal, and in that confined living quarters any show of emotion would have been considered unbearably flash."Stamp would become one of the biggest figures of 1960s London, romantically linked to model Jean Shrimpton and actresses Julie Christie - his Far From the Madding Crowd co-star - and Brigitte Bardot.READ MORE: Breathtaking 'stadium effect' captured in eye of rare Hurricane Erin His only marriage came in 2002 - to an Australian pharmacist 35 years his junior - but that lasted just six years, according to the Guardian.Stamp famously roomed with fellow actor Michael Caine, who was also a rising star at the time. The pair lost touch, however, as he disclosed in an interview with The Guardian newspaper in 2015."We just went different ways. I can understand it: in many ways he was much more mature than me," he said of Caine, who was five years older."Caine gave me all my early values, like making sure you were doing good stuff, waiting for the right things – then as soon as he got away he did exactly the opposite. Went from one movie to another."After a few years away from the screen, Stamp appeared in the 1978 blockbuster Superman as the superhero's adversary, General Zod. He reprised the role of the comic book villain in the sequel two years later.More than two decades later Stamp went on to voice the role of Superman's father Jor-El in the TV series Smallville.His many screen credits also included his role as drag queen and trans woman Bernadette in the 1990s Australian comedy The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert.Of his eclectic career - including roles in Hollywood's Wall Street and The Adjustment Bureau - he told The Guardian that he had no ambitions, adding: "I've had bad experiences and things that didn't work out; my love for film sometimes diminishes but then it just resurrects itself."I never have to gee myself up, or demand a huge wage to get out of bed in the morning. I've done crap, because sometimes I didn't have the rent. But when I've got the rent, I want to do the best I can."DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.
